Target: OntoClimateAdapt is an ontology designed to provide a formal semantic representation of data related to climate change adaptation research, initiatives, and actions. It enables the standardized description, integration, and interoperable exchange of information to support the development of resilient societies and adaptive capacities in the face of climate change.

Comment: An Environmental Phenomenon that represents a persistent alteration in the statistical properties of the climate system.
A causal relationship between an effect (or phenomenon) and the process, or event responsible for its occurrence.
Label: hasCause

Comment: A causal relationship between a phenomenon and the observable processes, events, or conditions that result from it.
Label: hasEffect

Comment: The relationship between a natural or environmental phenomenon and the scientific disciplines that systematically investigate it.
Label: studiedBy

Comment: An influence relationship between a phenomenon, process, or event and the systems, entities, or domains that experience its impact.
Label: affects

Comment: A deliberate action, strategy, or intervention implemented to reduce the adverse impacts of climate change
Label: AdaptationMeasure

Comment: A concrete activity or measure undertaken to reduce the impacts of climate change or increase the resilience of human or natural systems.
Label: ClimateAdaptationAction

Comment: A governance-led adaptation measure implemented through regulations, policies, legislation, incentives, or planning frameworks.
Label: PolicyIntervention

Comment: An adaptation measure that strengthens, upgrades, or redesigns physical infrastructure to withstand climate-related hazards.
Label: InfrastructureResilienceMeasure

Comment: The source of measurement, estimation, or observation through which evidence of climate change is obtained.
Label: measuredBy

Comment: A computational model that applies mathematical equations to simulate the behaviour of the Earth’s climate system.
Label: ClimateModel

Comment: A remote sensing measurement capturing key environmental or atmospheric variables of the Earth’s surface and climate system.
Label: SatelliteObservation

Comment: A ground-based facility that measures atmospheric and weather variables such as temperature, humidity, precipitation, and wind.
Label: MeteorologicalStation

Comment: A naturally occurring process within the environment arising from interactions among biological, physical, or chemical components.
Label: EnvironmentalPhenomenon

Comment: A large-scale physical, chemical, or biological process that occurs within or across components of the Earth system.
Label: EarthSystemPhenomenon

Comment: Any atmospheric or weather-related phenomenon that deviates drastically from normal conditions and poses risks to humans, ecosystems, or infrastructure.
Label: MeteorologicalExtremeEvent

Comment: A relation linking an event to the geographical location where it takes place or manifests its observable impacts.
Label: occursAt

Comment: A meteorological extreme event consisting of several consecutive days of unusually high temperatures relative to local climate norms.
Label: Heatwave

Comment: Relates a Location to its corresponding PopulationDensity measurement.
Label: hasPopulationDensity

Comment: A quantitative demographic indicator representing the number of individuals residing within a defined unit area of a geographic location.
Label: PopulationDensity

Comment: A group of people whose ages fall within a specified range.
Label: AgeGroup

Comment: A relation indicating that a population density measurement applies to a specific age group defined by a minimum and maximum age.
Label: forAgeGroup

Comment: A data property that specifies the lower bound of the age range defining an age group.
Label: hasMinimumAge

Comment: A data property that specifies the upper bound of the age range defining an age group.
Label: hasMaximumAge

Comment: A quantitative observation describing the total count of days during which heatwave conditions occur at a given location within a defined time interval.
Label: NumberOfHeatwaveDays

Comment: An object property that relates a location to an observation representing the number of days during which heatwave conditions occur.
Label: hasNumberOfHeatwaveDays

Comment: An object property that relates a derived quantitative indicator to one or more events from which the indicator has been computed or aggregated.
Label: isDerivedFromEvent

Comment: An object property that links an observation to the temporal frequency at which the observed quantity is defined, measured, or aggregated.
Label: hasTemporalFrequency

Comment: The regularity or recurrence pattern according to which an observation or aggregated value is defined, such as annually, monthly, or weekly.
Label: TemporalFrequency

Comment: A temporal frequency representing the count of occurrences within a calendar year.
Label: AnnualFrequency

Comment: A temporal frequency representing the count of occurrences within a calendar month.
Label: MonthlyFrequency

Comment: A temporal frequency representing the count of occurrences within a calendar week.
Label: WeeklyFrequency

Comment: An object property that relates an aggregated observation result to the temporal interval over which it was computed.
Label: hasTimeInterval

Comment: The radiative temperature of the Earth’s land surface at a specific location and time.
Label: LandSurfaceTemperature

Comment: An object property that relates a location to its land surface temperature at a specific time.
Label: hasLandSurfaceTemperature

Comment: The time instant when the temperatue was recorded.
Label: measuredAtTime
